thread.title: Bride-to-be was so embarrassed by snap of her looking like the ‘HONEY MONSTER’ she shed 5st and became a beauty queen
thread.title_full: Bride-to-be was so embarrassed by snap of her looking like the ‘HONEY MONSTER’ she shed 5st and became a beauty queen

author: amaloney
title: Bride-to-be was so embarrassed by snap of her looking like the ‘HONEY MONSTER’ she shed 5st and became a beauty queen
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments AN OBESE bride-to-be was so mortified by a picture her fiancé took of her looking like “the Honey Monster,” that she lost five stone and won a beauty contest. 
Kayleigh Atkinson, 25, weighed 17st 7lb when she was snapped looking hot and sweaty as she walked up a hill. PA 7 Kayleigh was horrified by this picture of her struggling to walk up a hill 
Disgusted with the picture, she swapped calorific ready meals for wholesome shakes – shedding three stone in the three months before her wedding. 
Kayleigh recalled: “When I looked at the photo I felt sick. 
“It was January 2015 and I looked like the Honey Monster, and thought, ‘Poor Liam is looking at that!’ 
“I’d been for a walk with Liam and my brother – who’d bounded up the hill, while I’d struggled to walk up it. PA Real Life/Sophotogenic Wedding Photography 7 Bride-to-be who looked like the Honey Monster slims to win beauty pageant 
“After seeing the photo, I felt so awful, I couldn’t wait to get home. When I weighed myself and saw I was 17.5 stone, I thought, ‘Are you joking?’ 
Stunning nurse, Kayleigh, 25, was disgusted by snap of her 17.5st bulky frame and after vowing to lose weight, shed five stone. 
“I was too embarrassed to tell Liam what I weighed, but knew I wanted to get the pounds off asap. He downloaded an app and cooked me healthy meals. He was really supportive.” 
Kayleigh dropped three stone, and was 14st 7lbs when she tied the knot with green keeper Liam Atkinson on 11 April 2015 in the Tees Valley and says she felt a million dollars in her ivory lace princess gown and was showered with compliments. 
Jetting off on their honeymoon for ten days to Jamaica, the couple from Newton Aycliffe, in County Durham soaked up the Caribbean sunshine – also sipping cocktails and tucking into the local food. 
But when Kayleigh saw a poolside snap taken on Liam’s phone, of her wearing an orange smock, horrified by her bulges, she vowed to take drastic action. PA 7 Honeymoon indulgence made her put on weight again 
She said: “I put on weight on our honeymoon. I was eating normal dinners and snacks, chicken, rice, pasta. 
“We had American style breakfasts, donuts and pancakes. It wasn’t good for my waistline.” 
At the end of the honeymoon she had piled the pounds back on and weighed almost 17 stone again. 
Kayleigh admitted she always enjoyed tucking in to her mum Lynda Coulthard’s, home-cooked meals, and weighed around 12 stone when she was 16. 
But, at 5ft 8in, she carried her weight well and Liam never commented on her size – happily tucking into pizzas in front of the TV and restaurant meals with her. PA Real Life 7 Bride-to-be who looked like the Honey Monster slims to win beauty pageant 
Her job as a children’s nurse didn’t help her waistline either, as she worked long shifts, relying on canteen food, like jacket potatoes and crisps – also gobbling down chocolates, given to her as thank you presents by patients and their families. 
But post honeymoon, in August 2015, she was ready to battle the bulge once and for all – joining Weight Watchers. 
Three months in to the diet, she slipped down the stairs, dislocating her ankle, also needing a plate and screws in the joint and plenty of rest. RELATED STORIES WISHFUL SHRINKING 18st man says taxpayer-funded £8,000 weight loss op has 'RUINED his life' - stopping him gorging on Burger King and six loaves of bread a day ‘waste of a pretty face’ Student who beat the trolls and lost 7st shows off her incredible transformation online 'I WAS MORTIFIED' Shame of unflattering photo being sent round work made woman lose over NINE STONE UNFITBIT FOR PURPOSE As experts claim health gadgets do more harm than good we ask: Are fitness apps ruining your life? 'That guy is a bum' Lad thinks he’s got lucky after texting a girl... before making this one fatal error 
Determined not to let the setback curb her weight loss plans for long, she rejoined her slimming class in January 2016, weighing 16st 5lbs, and within six months lost four stone, eating healthy, calorie controlled meals. 
Weighing 12st 11lbs, Kayleigh now feels ‘amazing,’ despite still being classed as overweight, according to NHS guidelines which say she should weigh around 11.5st. 
She said: “I feel perfect as I am, although I’m still classed as overweight. 
“According to the NHS, I’m still overweight and not healthy, but I am. I go to the gym twice a week and eat porridge or toast for breakfast, and healthy stir-fries. 
“I don’t need to lose more weight.” PA 7 Kayleigh is happy with her new weight after shedding stones with Weight Watchers 
Given a massive confidence boost by her new slimline shape, late last year Kayleigh entered a beauty competition – determined to get some recognition for her amazing weight loss. 
“The pageant was all about inner sparkle,” she said. “And I felt like I’d got my sparkle back.” 
She was chosen as Mrs County Durham in the Miss Galaxy Pageant system. 
“Since then I’ve been going to events as Mrs County Durham to help raise money for charities like MIND, the British Heart Foundation, and the Christie Charity 
“I never thought I’d be a beauty queen, but I’ve got the pageant bug now and will be representing my region in Lancashire, on 9 March, which could take me to America in the summer for the final, to represent the UK. 
“It’s great to finally see pictures of myself in swimwear and to feel proud.” 
Earlier, we revealed the story of an 18st man who says his £8000 weight loss op has ruined his life. PA Liam supported his bride by helping her cook healthy meals PA Pretty Kayleigh says she now has her ‘sparkle’ back Women celebrate losing 20 stone by recording inspirational weight loss song with Alexandra Burke
